name: US Cigarette Commercials Quiz | Marketing | 10 Questions

questions.text: This cigarette brand encouraged its prospective customers to "Come to where the flavor is, come to ____________". Where did the advertisers want the viewers to go?
options: The Pleasant Flavor Palace of Parliament
questions.explanation:
Marlboro Country.

	Sadly, David McClean, one of the actors who appeared in several Marlboro ads, died of cancer. His family later sued the tobacco industry.

questions.text: Smokers of what cigarette brands would rather "fight than switch"?
questions.explanation:
Tareyton.

	Tareyton featured a charcoal and white filter tip. At the end of the commercial an actor with a black eye would quote their "I would rather fight than switch" mantra.

questions.text: "Newport smokes ________________ than any other ___________ cigarette". What two words complete this 1960s cigarette commercial jingle?
questions.explanation:
Fresher, menthol.

	The jingle aired on US TV during the 1960s. The ad featured the cigarette's white filter, menthol and mint flavors and "great tasting tobaccos".

questions.text: A 1961 Muriel Cigar commercials featured a sexy Edie Adams asking what question?
questions.correct: Why don't you pick one up and smoke it sometime?
options: I love a man who smokes a Muriel. Do you love a woman who smokes one too?
Will you bring the Muriels over to my house tonight?
Do you like fresh taste? You'll love Muriels.
questions.explanation:
Why don't you pick one up and smoke it sometime?.

	The commercial stated you could enjoy real smoking pleasure without inhaling.  It was marketed as a "small cigar with the light taste".

questions.text: What feature sets Oasis cigarettes apart from its competitors, according to their commercials?
options: The cigarettes came in different flavors (grape, orange etc.)
The filters were shaped like a cone
The paper was soaked in beeswax for smoother smoking flavor
questions.explanation:
The tobacco was gently misted.

	The commercial (that began airing in 1961) promised that "just like the mist of the morning dew refreshes a flower and keeps it fresh all day, the tobaccos used in Oasis are misted with menthol for the softest and most refreshing taste of all".

questions.text: What cigarette brand promised that its product was "cool and refreshing as a summer shower"?
questions.explanation:
Newport.

	Newport's jingles featured its special combination of menthol, mint and the world's finest tobaccos.  The refreshing summer shower commercial appeared in 1962.

questions.text: "___________ tastes good like a cigarette should." What goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
Winston.

	These 1950 commercial jingles used their catchy tune to advertise Winston's "full rich tobacco taste" with its "easy drawing" filter.

questions.text: What animated cartoon character advertised Lucky Strike cigarettes in the 1950s?
questions.explanation:
Happy Joe Lucky.

	In the 1950s, Happy Joe joined singer Gisele MacKenzie in jingles that featured Lucky Strike's "toasted tobacco taste".

questions.text: What cigarette product proclaimed "you've come a long way baby"?
questions.explanation:
Virginia Slims.

	The commercials advertised that Virginia Slims provided "taste for today's woman" with rich Virginia flavor and a cigarette "tailored slim to fit a lady's hand and lips".

questions.text: What famous actor was featured in a 1985 commercial air by the American Cancer Society urging people to quit smoking? It aired just after his death from lung cancer.
questions.explanation:
Yul Brynner.

	Brynner asked to film the ad and requested it aired after his death. In it he said "Now that I'm gone I tell you don't smoke...whatever you do just don't smoke."  Other stars that recorded similar commercials included John Wayne, Sammy Davis Jr. and William Talman.
